ghostPost.title: Fission on the IPFS Community Call
ghostPost.excerpt: Fission presented what we've been up to on the IPFS Weekly Call on March 9th, 2020.
ghostPost.custom_excerpt: Fission presented what we've been up to on the IPFS Weekly Call on March 9th, 2020.

authors.name: FISSION Team
authors.bio: Exploring fundamental shifts in the way we host, deploy, and run software for humans, using decentralized web technologies.

primary_author.name: FISSION Team
primary_author.bio: Exploring fundamental shifts in the way we host, deploy, and run software for humans, using decentralized web technologies.

ghostPost.plaintext:
Thanks to the IPFS team for hosting us on the weekly community call! These 
community calls happen weekly on Mondays at 1600 UTC
[https://talk.fission.codes/t/ipfs-weekly-community-calls/521].

We presented an intro to what we're building at Fission, including our hosted
services, open source contributions, and more.

We've started to use the phrase "web native apps" to describe Fission's app
creation platform that decouples storage from apps, with user controlled data,
and secure by default. Which is what is expected by users ¬†from native mobile
apps.

You can watch the video ‚Äì stored on IPFS! ‚Äì here:

https://ipfs.runfission.com/ipfs/QmdAdEPac3X41pVZE2m3EUJibg5mXqtW6sE5LuMDV5mR7x/Fission%20Building%20Web%20Native%20Apps%20IPFS%20Weekly%20Call%202020-03-09.mp4

 Originally from the IPFS YouTube [https://youtu.be/wvmZj7IE9Bo]The slides are available on IPFS as a PDF
[https://events.fission.name/2020/ipfs-community-call/Fission-IPFS-Community-Call-March2020.pdf]
:

Also on Notist [https://noti.st/bmann/TltFLG/fission-building-web-native-apps]
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

From the final slide, here are all the places where you can find out more and
connect with us:

 * Github: fission-suite [https://github.com/fission-suite]
 * Install Guide & Docs: guide.fission.codes [https://guide.fission.codes]
 * Technical Whitepaper: whitepaper.fission.codes
   [https://whitepaper.fission.codes]  ¬†‚Äì this is a work in progress! üöß üë∑‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è‚úçÔ∏è
 * Discourse forum: talk.fission.codes [https://talk.fission.codes]
 * Discord chat: fission.codes/discourse [https://fission.codes/discourse]
 * Twitter: @fissioncodes [https://twitter.com/fissioncodes], team accounts 
   @expede [https://twitter.com/expede],@bmann [https://twitter.com/bmann], 
   @icidasset [https://twitter.com/icidasset], and @dholms on Github
   [https://github.com/dholms]
ghostPost.html:
Thanks to the IPFS team for hosting us on the weekly community call! These community calls happen weekly on Mondays at 1600 UTC.

We presented an intro to what we're building at Fission, including our hosted services, open source contributions, and more.

We've started to use the phrase "web native apps" to describe Fission's app creation platform that decouples storage from apps, with user controlled data, and secure by default. Which is what is expected by users ¬†from native mobile apps.

You can watch the video ‚Äì stored on IPFS! ‚Äì here:

The slides are available on IPFS as a PDF:

From the final slide, here are all the places where you can find out more and connect with us:

  • Github: fission-suite
  • Install Guide & Docs: guide.fission.codes
  • Technical Whitepaper: whitepaper.fission.codes ¬†‚Äì this is a work in progress! üöß üë∑‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è‚úçÔ∏è
  • Discourse forum: talk.fission.codes
  • Discord chat: fission.codes/discourse
  • Twitter: @fissioncodes, team accounts @expede, ¬†@bmann, @icidasset, and @dholms on Github
